I was about to quit KSP,but this happened

![OgLJSUy.png](%5Bimg%5Dhttp%3A//i.imgur.com/OgLJSUy.png)

I read the KSwiki, it says you only have 1/40 chance to make this happen.

(i must be really lucky:cool:)

I am really surprised to see this(coz u know, its rare(duh))
But is it realy possible to make a sandcastle on the mun ?
I dont know if its a yes or a no.

Can confirm this is real. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Haven't seen this for myself, but I keep hoping.
I just saw the Mun sandcastle today too. I'm pretty sure its chance of occurring is much lower than 1/40, that was what it was back in 0.18 or so.

> 
> I read the KSwiki, it says you only have 1/40 chance to make this happen.

It doesn't work 1/40 for me. I played KSP for nearly 2 years, racking up over 1000 hours and nearly as many game starts, and never once saw it. Then suddenly one day the castle appeared. And it continued to appear every single time I started the game for about a week, like 20 or 30 times in a row. And it hasn't appeared since, with hundreds more game starts.
I've seen this. There's also a scene where the Kerbals are standing around the crashed lander looking at it.
The castle appeared multiple times in a week? Weird. I've seen it two or three times over the years. It just occasionally pops up. Always a joy to see when it does.
I've seen it twice.
That's awesome, I've never seen it! I want to now though!

It's right there in the first post.

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

I've not seen it in ages, not since 0.90.0 I think. Before then I've seen it 4 or 5 times, admittedly I did play more KSP then (and the game used to crash more, so more restarts), but I still play quite a lot.

I've only seen the regolith castle once in hundreds of games. 

I'm pretty sure I saw a bunch of Kerbals on the mun having a party but I can't remember much about it and don't have a screenshot and can't find on on the googles. Maybe I was dreamed it, or was drunk. Or both.

I've heard of this, except I have never seen one. And I've been playing for 1 year and 1.5 months.

EDIT: I thought I would get lucky right now because of this post, except I'm on the orbiting Kerbin Screen.

I've been playing for maybe a little over a year, and have never seen that. I have about 500 hours, but I never knew that was even there. I'll keep an eye out for this mythic castle.
I've seen it before, but I amused it was just there all the time and never looked for it again after.

> 
> But is it realy possible to make a sandcastle on the mun ?

Since nice footprints can form in regolith, I don't see why a small regolithcastle shouldn't be possible. This is why we need to send people back to the moon, to answer proper science questions like this.

EDIT: NASA disagrees with me:

*"Lunar dust has some interesting qualities, but itÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s clearly not play material for children or adults. Building a sandcastle on the moon would be dangerous and impossible. No liquid water puts a stop to sandcastle creations. On Earth, water sticks to the sand, and causes sand particles to stick to each other. On the moon, because there is no water, lunar dust cannot stick to itself. You could never build a sandcastle on the moon.*

Source: [http://education.jsc.nasa.gov/explorers/p10.html"](http://education.jsc.nasa.gov/explorers/p10.html)
